last_episode_to_air.name: The Mike Gaffigan Show
last_episode_to_air.overview: During a scary storm, Jim consoles his children by telling them a story from his own childhood and in the process learns an important lesson about his past.

name: The Jim Gaffigan Show
overview: Comedy about a husband and wife trying to raise their five kids in a New York two-bedroom apartment.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Comedy about a husband and wife trying to raise their five kids in a New York two-bedroom apartment.

episodes.name: Red Velvet If You Please
episodes.overview: Jeannie asks Jim to run some important errands, including dropping off their daughter's application to a prestigious Catholic girls' school.

episodes.name: A Night at the Plaza
episodes.overview: Jim organizes a romantic anniversary including a Broadway show and a short hotel stay

episodes.name: In the Name of the Father
episodes.overview: Jim and Jeannie agree to dine with Daniel and his father in order to act as buffers; Dave joins the group for a wild night.

episodes.name: Super Great Daddy Day
episodes.overview: Jeannie asks Jim to run some important errands, including dropping off their daughter's application to a prestigious Catholic girls' school.

episodes.name: Go Shorty, It's Your Birthday
episodes.overview: Jim celebrates Dave's birthday instead of Jeannie's, and even though she told him not to give her a gift or celebrate, Jeannie gets upset.

episodes.name: My Friend the Priest
episodes.overview: When Jim is finally invited to do "The Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon," Jeannie invites Father Nicholas along, making Jim more nervous.

episodes.name: Superdad
episodes.overview: Jim is called "superdad" in a magazine, and although Jeannie is happy for Jim, she is upset that there is no mention of her.

episodes.name: The Bible Story
episodes.overview: After Jim is photographed holding a Bible, he finds himself at the center of a firestorm.

episodes.name: Maria
episodes.overview: After one of Jim's creepy friends asks Jeannie's sister out, Jim and Jeannie spend the night out in town hunting her down trying to stop what ever may happen from happening. Meanwhile Jim tries to eat and enjoy himself.

episodes.name: Wonderful
episodes.overview: After getting frustrated with sick, lice-infested children, Jim wishes that he never got married and became a father.

episodes.name: The Calling
episodes.overview: Jim searches for his purpose in life and finds startling answers.

episodes.name: The Trial
episodes.overview: Jim is jailed and placed on trial for a crime he may or may not have committed.

episodes.name: Ugly
episodes.overview: Jim receives the opportunity of a lifetime but it's a tough pill to swallow.

episodes.name: The List
episodes.overview: Jim faces a harsh reality on where he stands in public perception and undertakes a quest to regain his position.

episodes.name: No Good Deed (1)
episodes.overview: Jim tries to help his friend Dave who has hit a low point in his career.

episodes.name: No Good Deed (2)
episodes.overview: Jim finds out that a huge movie star has taken an interest in him and flies to LA for an exciting project. But will his nerves get the better of him?

episodes.name: No Good Deed (3)
episodes.overview: Jim is enlisted to help Dave with a project and things get completely out of control.

episodes.name: He Said She Said
episodes.overview: Jim and Jeannie have a huge fight and seek Father Nicholas's counsel only to discover what they are truly in conflict about.

episodes.name: My Brother's Keeper
episodes.overview: Jim's brother visits New York and makes a life altering decision. Jim must decide if he should support his brother or follow his heart.

episodes.name: Jim at the Museum
episodes.overview: Jim takes all of his kids to the museum by himself and has an adventure that no one will forget.

episodes.name: Bosom Buddies
episodes.overview: Jeannie heads out of town with the kids and Jim navigates New York City alone for the weekend.

episodes.name: The Mike Gaffigan Show
episodes.overview: During a scary storm, Jim consoles his children by telling them a story from his own childhood and in the process learns an important lesson about his past.
